column5: I need a new charger I remember reading here about other chargers but can not remember what the other brand was that most liked.  What are you using?
Get yourself a Guest charger Mike, their excellent.
Another vote for Guest here, Mike.
That was the name I was confused as CTC has Genius ones I did not think that was the name. What places have the best prices? Thanks guys
I had guest for years sold it when I sold the boat and bought a cheaper make wish I bought a guest
I can only find them online and my local store does not have them listed in their books and have not heard of them. I guess I am buying online
The last Guest I bought was back in '99 Mike and I got it from West Marine in Toronto but I have no idea if they still carry them or even if they'd ship you one.
Got mine from Cabela's, Mike.  I had to get mine online but you probably get down there from time to time ? Mine is model 2611.
Ok thanks guys I will look at both of them

Guest is the answer. I bought mine at BPS a few years back. It finally calfed and had to buy another one as well. BPS no longer carrys Guest now=bummer. Went with their BPS brand tourney pro series. 2 yrs and running, hope I get another 10 or 12 yrs yet with it...  Cheers, Ron...

I have the Nautilus three bank from CT. It's made by Schumacher Electric and re-branded with the Nautilus brand. Comes with a 5 year warranty. Had an issue with a fan in mine in year 4 and got a replacement no questions asked. I'm pretty sure the NOCO Genius is the replacement for it. It also carries a 5 year warranty.
I have been using a Bass Pro brand for 4 years without a problem . The Bass pro charger are Pro Mariners.
MinnKota is a charger in my boat.
Here's what I'm using Mike, worked well now for 4 years...On sale too!  http://www.basspro.com/ProMariner-ProSport-Series-Onboard-Marine-Battery-Chargers/product/97825/

My 2006 Ranger came with a 4 bank Dual Pro. Prior to the Ranger I had a Triton and it came with a Dual Pro.....had that boat for 6+ years. And before the Triton I had a Lund ProV and it also had a Dual pro. That one was replaced free when something went wrong with it after 4 years of use.
Dual Pro are the best on the market. Mine is 15 yrs old and still works awesome. Might be why I get at least 5-7 yrs out of all my batteries.
I need a 4 bank for my boat...guess I'll be shopping for a Dual Pro as well.
Guest gets my vote, have owned 2 and neither has failed. First one was 7yrs old when I sold the boat.
